title: Could --help be more robust?
body:
#### What is the problem?
any internal failure somewhere with imports etc (e.g. #1934) makes datalad --help to crash, as caught by the unittest we have and here is the full traceback:

```shell
$ /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/bin/datalad --help
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/bin/datalad", line 8, in <module>
    main()
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/cmdline/main.py", line 297, in main
    parser = setup_parser()
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/cmdline/main.py", line 208, in setup_parser
    _mod = import_module(_intfspec[0], package='datalad')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module
    __import__(name)
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/metadata/search.py", line 40, in <module>
    from datalad.support.json_py import dump2fileobj as jsondump2file
  File "/home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/datalad/support/json_py.py", line 14, in <module>
    import lzma
ImportError: /home/buildbot/datalad-pr-docker-dl-nd90/build/venv-ci/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/lzma.so: undefined symbol: lzma_alone_encoder
```
Ideally, there should be an ERROR message (that something went wrong, with some detail) but then still --help produced for the rest of the things
